name: 陳玉敏
objective: Chaucer and Shakespeare is a semester course designed to introduce the two masters from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance with a comparative approach. The course will investigate the historical and social contexts, and examine the authors’ innovation in poetic language, dramatic structure, and theatre. We will also examine various texts ranging from music, opera, paintings, plays, and films. We will also compare and contrast how the themes of love, power, and death were presented differently. By reviewing film adaptations of selected Shakespeare plays, students will learn theatrical and cinematic terms, canonical Shakespearean auteurs, scholars, and literary theories.
